content.description: A tricky dihedral climb, with a couple gear placements. Beta can be a little difficult to figure out on the first try.
content.location: the middle climb of the three routes on this wall.

content.description: Begin in the central handcrack of Trivial Pursuit, and then split off to the right about 10 feet off the ground, going up the obvious left-facing corner system.  Finishes just right of Trivial Pursuit and shares an anchor.
content.protection: Single rack to 2".  Small cams (aliens, TCUs) can be beneficial.
content.location: Rightmost route on the small Trivial Wall area.  Climbs the corner and the face to the right of the corner.

content.description: The route starts up the slab section of Harlequin. Once you reach the second big hold you go up and left from there. Crux is a little past halfway up moving to a small pocket. Toward the end there is a fun opportunity to use the about fist sized crack to the left to pull into the final top out.
content.protection: Anchors at top, there are no bolts but some decent spots for some cams, approx 1-1.5" cracks going through the middle section.
content.location: You find the start of the route either from the main trails and scrambling up to the base of the Trivial wall section or you rappel down from one of the many anchor spots in the area on top.

content.description: This short route is a little tricky to figure out. Can be TR'd from above, or lead with gear to 1.5".
content.location: Left most of three routes on this little section of wall. A TR can be set from the tree above, or off the bolts.

content.description: This small wall has three routes (left to right: 10a, 10a, 8) that are dirty and short, but otherwise fun. The best line is the middle one.
